title: funny games
excerpt: Michael Hanekeâ€™s Funny Games is not a typical thriller; it is an assault on the viewer. As a family is held hostage in their own holiday home, the captors treat their suffering as a game, even addressing the camera to ensure the audience is 'enjoying' the spectacle of their systematic destruction.

quote: Discomfort, dread and doom. I did not laugh once.

title: his girl friday
excerpt: His Girl Friday is a masterpiece of witty banter and cynical journalism. Set against the backdrop of a high-stakes jailbreak, it follows a woman torn between the stability of a quiet life and the addictive, ink-stained chaos of the newsroom she shares with her charmingly ruthless ex.

title: m - fritz lang
excerpt: A city listens. A killer whistles. Fear spreads faster than guilt in Fritz Langâ€™s *M*.

title: last tango in paris
excerpt: Last Tango in Paris is a haunting look at the intersection of grief and obsession. As two strangers attempt to strip away their identities and lose themselves in one another, they discover that the walls they build to keep the world out cannot protect them from the reality of who they are.

title: leviathan
excerpt: A modern-day retelling of the story of Job, Leviathan follows a manâ€™s desperate struggle to save his ancestral home from a corrupt mayor. Against the stark beauty of the Russian Arctic, it is a haunting examination of what happens when a citizen is crushed by the very institutions meant to protect him.

title: martyrs
excerpt: Not for the faint of heart, Martyrs explores the dark intersection of religious obsession and physical agony. It is a cold, calculated look at a cultâ€™s attempt to manufacture a miracle, culminating in one of the most debated and haunting final scenes in horror history.

title: melancholia
excerpt: Lars von Trier explores the beauty of destruction in this stunning sci-fi drama. It asks a terrifying question: if life on Earth is truly 'evil,' is its ending a tragedy or a relief? It is a film about the paralyzing nature of sadness and the strange grace found in accepting the inevitable.

title: persona
excerpt: When a nurse is tasked with caring for an actress who has mysteriously gone mute, their isolation on a remote island leads to a disturbing merging of identities. This avant-garde masterpiece explores the masks we wear and the terrifying moment when the face behind the mask begins to disappear.
image_description: two faces overlapping, black and white portrait

title: play misty for me
excerpt: Set against the rugged, beautiful coastline of Carmel, Play Misty for Me is a tense psychological study of a man hunted by a woman he barely knows. Itâ€™s a chilling reminder that behind a friendly voice on the radio, there may be a mind spiraling out of control.

title: prey
excerpt: An American familyâ€™s dream vacation becomes a fight for survival when they are trapped in a stalled vehicle by a pride of hungry lions. In the heart of the South African wild, they must find a way to outwit natureâ€™s most relentless predators before the heatâ€”or the lionsâ€”get to them first.

title: pulp fiction
excerpt: The lives of two hitmen, a boxer, a mobster's wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in a series of funny, violent, and unexpected incidents. This masterpiece of 90s cinema turns a gritty underworld into a playground of brilliant dialogue and unforgettable characters.

title: robocop
excerpt: Part man, part machine, all cop. In a crime-ridden future Detroit, a murdered police officer is resurrected as an unstoppable cyborgâ€”only to realize that his true creators may be more dangerous than the criminals he was built to hunt.
image_description: futuristic city police, chrome metal texture

title: scent of a woman
excerpt: Set against the backdrop of a high-society New York weekend, this film is a masterful blend of humor and heartbreak. It follows an embittered veteran and a struggling student as they navigate a series of life-changing encounters, culminating in a courtroom defense that is one of the most celebrated scenes in movie history.

title: schindlers list
excerpt: Amidst the darkness of World War II, a charismatic German businessman risks his fortune and his life to turn his factory into a sanctuary for over a thousand Jewish prisoners. This unflinching look at the Holocaust is a testament to the incredible impact a single individual can have in the face of absolute evil.

title: solaris
excerpt: What if the stars didn't offer new life, but reflected your oldest regrets? In this visually stunning Soviet classic, the boundaries between reality and memory dissolve as a crew of researchers is haunted by 'visitors' pulled directly from their subconscious minds.
image_description: space station window, swirling ocean water

title: some like it hot
excerpt: To escape the mob, two musicians go undercover in the best way they know how: by joining an all-girl band in drag. Itâ€™s a hilarious, high-speed chase involving a ukulele-playing Marilyn Monroe, a persistent millionaire, and the funniest identity crisis ever caught on film.

title: carnival of souls
image_description: abandoned carnival, ghostly face in water
excerpt: After miraculously surviving a tragic car accident, a young woman moves to a new city only to find herself stalked by a pale, silent stranger. Trapped in a dreamlike purgatory, she is drawn to an abandoned lakeside pavilion where the ghosts of her past are waiting to dance.

title: housemaid
excerpt: When a middle-class family hires a mysterious housemaid to help with their new home, a single moment of infidelity sparks a depraved cycle of blackmail and revenge. In this claustrophobic masterpiece, the very house intended to signify their success becomes a gilded cage of psychological terror.

title: alien
excerpt: On a lonely journey back to Earth, a commercial crew encounters a terrifying alien species with a deadly life cycle. Trapped in a steel tomb millions of miles from help, their only goal is to survive the night.

title: the lodger
excerpt: The Lodger is a classic silent thriller directed by Alfred Hitchcock and is often regarded as his first true masterpiece. Released in 1927, the film tells the suspenseful story of a mysterious lodger suspected of being a serial killer terrorizing fog-covered London.

title: rear window
excerpt: A bored photographer recovering from a broken leg passes the time by watching his neighbors and begins to suspect one of them of murder.

title: rope
excerpt: Two men try to convince themselves they've committed the perfect murder by hosting a dinner party after strangling a former classmate to death.
